metadata.title: Keyboard Geography
metadata.description: Learn to navigate the keyboard by playing different C notes

hints.beforeStart: This exercise explores the keyboard vertically. Find the low C below Middle C (C3, 48 MIDI), then Middle C (C4, 60 MIDI), then the high C above it (C5, 72 MIDI). All C notes have the same pattern of black keys between them.

commonMistakes.advice: Remember: C notes are always the white key to the LEFT of the two black keys. Moving up the keyboard, each new C is in the next group of two black keys to the right.
The left hand plays the low C (first note), then switch to your right hand for the higher C notes. It's okay to move your hand!

hints.successMessage: Great! You understand keyboard layout now. You can navigate up and down the keyboard to find any note.
